TopicTitle: [0.90][Plugin/WIP][Discontinued indefinitely] KittopiaTech Ingame Terraforming Tools V0.192

Articles.Content: If you save an alteration, scaledspace (map view model) *may* not update. In order to make sure an alteration has been saved, make sure to view the planet in question from a low orbit. The checkbox next to the save button (export textures) *should* allow scaledspace to update. but this WILL hang the game. Even if it looks like it crashed, just give it time to generate the scaledspace texture. If all works well, it should load into the map view. If not, I will see if I can get it working...
Suggestion for terraforming parts: make it harder to terraform planets closer to the sun and once terraformed they will get hotter and a part that stablizes terraformed planets way up the tech tree.

Just wondering if anyone has had luck adding new PQS mods to planets. I wanted to give minmus some craters but upon adding the crater mod and updating, the planet disappears completely and nothing brings it back. I'v tried this on several different planets and they all seem to have the same effect.

If you save an alteration, scaledspace (map view model) *may* not update. In order to make sure an alteration has been saved, make sure to view the planet in question from a low orbit. The checkbox next to the save button (export textures) *should* allow scaledspace to update. but this WILL hang the game. Even if it looks like it crashed, just give it time to generate the scaledspace texture. If all works well, it should load into the map view. If not, I will see if I can get it working...

Scaledspace does update properly. I think I've made some progress; when updating Scaledspace with the export button checked, a CFG-file is created within the Kittopia folder with all the information about the planet. But when restarting the game, the planet appears in its 'original' state. The CFG-file starts with "// Customdata". I vaguely remember that "//" seems to disable code in a CFG-file?

Someone could say me how to lock the rings vÃƒÂ­a .cfg?

I love the plugin but the GUI is pretty wild for me... I prefer to set and modify my values manually. Thanks!

Someone could say me how to lock the rings vÃƒÂ­a .cfg?

I love the plugin but the GUI is pretty wild for me... I prefer to set and modify my values manually. Thanks!

Sure, the parameter should be "LockRot", simply add that underneath the "Tilt" parameter. I'm sorry about my awful GUI, though.

@Bekiekutmoar: The comment on the top is automatically generated by the confignode class I am using. And shouldn't effect the loading. However, I will look into the issues ASAP.
Thanks ... ! Btw, I've found out the comment in question doesn't have an influence on how a celestial object appears. Meanwhile, I'm testing out the capacities of Kittopia:

Hello, all. I've came to this thread today to discuss a bug with this mod that has been probably not told of before, but my apologies if it had. Has anyone noticed a bug when re-coloring a planet's surface (ex. I made Eve's surface golden yellow to look sandy), but when I start the game, (after exiting it), its surface color reverts to its usual purple. I'd appreciate to have this issue fixed, if possible! Reference photo.

Also, I've noticed another bug associated with making a celestial body orbit another. I can't get an encounter with the modded planet. I'd just appreciate to shed light on these bugs, and I can't thank you enough for making a mod as fantastic as this, KCreator!

Edited December 8, 2014 by Tynton

Good day,

I was wondering if it would be possible to add a ring that emits light to the game in the hopes of adding a realistic accretion disk to the Black Hole in the StarSystems WIP over on the Add-On Development Section.

There should be an option to make "unlit" rings, these will have the visual effect of luminance.

There should be an option to make "unlit" rings, these will have the visual effect of luminance.

I recently had my internet problem resolved, and I recompiled for .90. The UI now opens again, I apologise for the inconvenience.

Thanks for the update to 0.90. Rings can finally be added again, but they appear black/dark once I launch a vessel (they look fine if before you launch you check them out using the Map View). Using CTRL+P to edit the rings in-game also doesn't do anything. None of the things there (unlit, inclinination, etc.) do anything. Is it a bug or am I doing something wrong?

Thanks for the update to 0.90. Rings can finally be added again, but they appear black/dark once I launch a vessel (they look fine if before you launch you check them out using the Map View). Using CTRL+P to edit the rings in-game also doesn't do anything. None of the things there (unlit, inclinination, etc.) do anything. Is it a bug or am I doing something wrong?

I believe you have to edit those parameters BEFORE you add the ring.

Please help me ! I can't manage to select a planet !

Please help me ! I can't manage to select a planet !

Sorry for not answering sooner; to select a planet, open the UI and click select planet, a list of planets (as buttons) should appear in the lower half of the UI, click on the one you want to edit, and it should "lock" the planet in for editing.

I admin that this isn't exactly the most intuitive system, but it works, and I cant really do much else.

edit: I'm not entirely sure if the ring colour option works anymore, can anyone can confirm this?
